flavorText:
"A cliff once rose from the surf here—until Bjora Dawn-Greeter declared that it was blocking her view and pulled it down bare-handed."
—Iskene, Kannah storyteller

foreignData.flavorText:
„Hier erhob sich einst eine Klippe aus der Brandung — bis Bjora die Morgenrot-Grüßerin erklärte, sie versperre ihr die Sicht, und sie mit bloßen Händen herunterriss."
—Iskene, Kannah-Geschichtenerzählerin
foreignData.name: Gletscher-Flutebene
foreignData.text:
({T}: Erzeuge {W} oder {U}.)

foreignData.flavorText:
"Antaño, un peñasco se elevaba entre las olas, hasta que Bjora la Saludaamaneceres dijo que estaba tapando sus vistas y lo destruyó de un puñetazo".
—Iskene, cuentacuentos kannah
foreignData.name: Ribera glacial
foreignData.text:
({T}: Agrega {W} o {U}.)
La Ribera glacial entra al campo de batalla girada.

foreignData.flavorText:
« Autrefois, une colline s'élevait ici au milieu des vagues, jusqu'à ce que Bjora Salueuse-de-l'Aurore déclare qu'elle lui gâchait la vue et qu'elle décide de la détruire à mains nues. »
—Iskene, conteuse des Kannah
foreignData.name: Plaine d'inondation glaciale
foreignData.text:
({T} : Ajoutez {W} ou {U}.)
La Plaine d'inondation glaciale arrive sur le champ de bataille engagée.

foreignData.flavorText:
"Un tempo qui una scogliera si ergeva dai flutti, finché Bjora Testimone dell'Alba non l'ha distrutta a mani nude, perché le ostruiva la visuale."
—Iskene, cantastorie Kannah
foreignData.name: Piana Alluvionale Glaciale
foreignData.text:
({T}: Aggiungi {W} o {U}.)
La Piana Alluvionale Glaciale entra nel campo di battaglia TAPpata.

foreignData.flavorText:
「かつてここには波間から崖が迫り上がっていました。すると暁迎えのビョーラが、眺めを遮っていると言って素手で引き抜いてしまったのです。」
――カナーの語り部、イスキン
foreignData.name: 氷河の氾濫原
foreignData.text:
（{T}：{W}か{U}を加える。）
氷河の氾濫原はタップ状態で戦場に出る。

foreignData.flavorText:
"한때 이곳에는 절벽이 파도 위에 우뚝 서 있었지—새벽을 맞는 자 비요라가 그게 자기 시야를 가린다고 선언하고는 맨손으로 없애 버리기 전까진 말이야."
—카나 이야기꾼, 이스킨
foreignData.name: 빙하 범람지
foreignData.text:
({T}: {W} 또는 {U}를 추가한다.)
빙하 범람지는 탭된 채로 전장에 들어온다.

foreignData.flavorText:
"Uma vez, da superfície brotou um penhasco bem aqui. Até que Bjora Saúda-alvorada declarou que estava bloqueando sua visão e o arrancou com as mãos nuas."
— Iskene, contadora de histórias kannah
foreignData.name: Planície Aluvial Glacial

({T}: Adicione {W} ou {U}.)
Planície Aluvial Glacial entra no campo de batalha virada.

foreignData.flavorText:
«Здесь из воды возвышался когда-то утес — пока Бьора Приветствующая Зарю не заявила, что он портит ей вид, и не свалила его голыми руками».
— Искени, каннская сказительница

Ледовая Пойма выходит на поле битвы повернутой.

foreignData.flavorText:
「此处波涛拍岸，经年累月曾积起高耸冰崖～但有天报晓者碧约拉嫌它妨碍视线，便徒手将其夷为平地。」
～卡纳说书人伊斯琴

name: Glacial Floodplain
originalText:
({T}: Add {W} or {U}.)
Glacial Floodplain enters the battlefield tapped.

rulings.text: Snow is a supertype, not a card type. It has no rules meaning or function by itself, but spells and abilities may refer to it.
The {S} symbol is a generic mana symbol. It represents a cost that can be paid by one mana that was produced by a snow source. That mana can be any color or colorless.
Snow isn’t a type of mana. If an effect says you may spend mana as though it were any type, you can’t pay for {S} using mana that wasn’t produced by a snow source.
Some cards have additional effects for each {S} spent to cast them. You can cast these spells even if you don’t spend any snow mana to cast them; their additional effects simply won’t do anything.

The Kaldheim set doesn’t have any cards with mana costs that include {S}, but some previous sets do. If an effect says such a spell costs {1} less to cast, that reduction doesn’t apply to any {S} costs. This is also true for activated abilities that include {S} in their activation costs and effects that reduce those costs.

text:
({T}: Add {W} or {U}.)
Glacial Floodplain enters the battlefield tapped.
